Comments_List: I learned how to responsibly extrapolate nuances of a culture from texts. I also learned how to look for multicultural influences on a text.
Class discussion, how to talk about Medieval Literature

I gained extensive knowledge about Anglo Saxon language and culture through the numerous forms of literature that we read throughout the semester. I can read Old English now so that's also cool. I learned how to evaluate texts through a historical lens, and write about and analyze them.

Strengths: Reading a variety of texts/art pieces, learning a new language and culture.
Weaknesses: The restrictive prompts on the essays--I've gotten used to having more free choice/prompting questions for essays.

Strengths: extremely well-organized, well-structured, and engaging
Weaknesses: We never really engaged with the Anglo-Saxons textbook, even though we were assigned reading from it
Strengths: fun discussions, like how its taught with two professors

I would recommend it! Profs Thornbury and Reider taught us a lot, and I felt free to mess up, take leaps of faith, and just be myself and learn without feeling like I had to constantly give a "right" answer.
Yes! I took the course mostly to fulfill a medieval credit, but ended up really enjoying it.
Good class for the medieval requirement !! Great profs; fun discussions.

I would recommend this course to another student. I took it for the requirement, and I wasn't sure what to expect because I'm not specifically interested in the coursework. HOWEVER, the professors were amazing and it quickly become one of my favorite classes.
